text.p: A regular polygon has n number of sides. Each side has length s.

ul.li: The area of a regular polygon is: [mathjaxinline]\frac{0.25*n*s^2}{tan(\pi/n)}[/mathjaxinline]
The perimeter of a polygon is: length of the boundary of the polygon

text.p: Write a function called polysum that takes 2 arguments, n and s. This function should sum the area and square of the perimeter of the regular polygon. The function returns the sum, rounded to 4 decimal places.

section.p: Which library should you be importing at the beginning of your code in order to call the tan function and to get the pi constant?

text.p: This is an optional exercise, but great for extra practice!
